newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures end mixed, seen to drift.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures end mixed, seen to drift.

text.p: Rubber futures closed mixed on Friday in moderate trade with dealers concerned the market may drift next week in the absence of fresh factors, traders said. "It's dead. We're all sitting around, doing nothing. It's the end of the month and we hope the next month will come up with something better," a local rubber trader said.
Shortcovering in Japan which pushed up Tokyo's benchmark March contract 0.8 yen to 134.8 failed to inspire the local market.
The only action was provided by some forward buying for RSS3 rubber, dealers said.
"The volume became moderate towards the close on RSS3, but it was quiet in all other months," another trader said.
At around 0945 GMT, November RSS3 was seen at 123.00-124.00 U.S. cents a kg from 123.50 cents.

November RSS1 was seen at 177.00-178.00 Singapore cents (US$1.25-$1.26) a kg from Thursday's settlement of 178.00 cents. November TSR20 was seen at 172.00-174.00 Singapore cents (US$1.22-$1.23) a kg against the previous 172.00 cents.
